title: Nintendo lifts sales forecast as Switch 2 momentum builds
body: Nintendo has increased its sales target for the Switch 2 gaming system as the company sees strong customer interest in its newest product. The Japanese company said it now plans to sell 19 million Switch 2 units before the end of March 2026. That‚Äôs up from an earlier estimate of 15 million units. The company reported its financial results for the three months ending September 30. Nintendo brought in 527.2 billion yen, or roughly $3.7 billion, in revenue. Wall Street analysts had predicted 461.76 billion yen. The company earned 102.9 billion yen in profit, well above the expected 63.6 billion yen. Sales jumped more than 90% compared to the same period last year. Profits climbed over 270%. The gaming company introduced the Switch 2 in June, and shares have climbed nearly 40% so far this year as per CNBC. September quarter shows solid performance Nintendo moved 4.54 million Switch 2 units during the quarter ending in September. The company noted this was fewer than the ‚Äúhigh demand seen immediately following the launch of Nintendo Switch 2‚Äù in the previous three-month period, though it said sales ‚Äúremained strong.‚Äù Since hitting stores, the Switch 2 has sold 10.36 million units total. Two games have become big hits for the new system. ‚ÄúMario Kart World‚Äù and ‚ÄúDonkey Kong Bonanza‚Äù helped Nintendo sell 11.95 million software titles for the Switch 2 during the quarter. The positive response to the Switch 2 led Nintendo to adjust other financial targets as well. The Kyoto-based company now expects total sales of 2.25 trillion yen for the fiscal year, up from its previous goal of 1.9 trillion yen. It also raised its profit forecast by almost 17% to 350 billion yen. Original Switch sets high bar for success The first Switch console came out in 2017 and became Nintendo‚Äôs second-highest-selling system ever, trailing only the Nintendo DS. People liked being able to play games both at home on their TV and while traveling. Some observers wondered if the Switch 2 would offer enough new features to convince people to buy it. Early sales numbers suggest customers are responding well. Analysts will watch the current quarter closely, especially with the busy holiday shopping period approaching. Nintendo kept the original Switch selling for years by releasing games featuring well-known characters like Super Mario and Pokemon. The company plans to use the same approach with the Switch 2. Last month, Nintendo put out ‚ÄúPok√©mon Legends: Z-A‚Äù and offered a package deal that includes the game with the Switch 2 console. Two more titles, ‚ÄúKirby Air Riders‚Äù and ‚ÄúMetroid Prime 4: Beyond,‚Äù are set to come out later this year. ‚ÄúWe will aim to keep the momentum of released titles and continuously introduce new titles to expand the platform‚Äôs user base,‚Äù the company said in its earnings statement. Get seen where it counts. Advertise in Cryptopolitan Research and reach crypto‚Äôs sharpest investors and builders.

title: Crypto Futures Liquidation: The Shockwave of $250 Million in One Hour
body: BitcoinWorld Crypto Futures Liquidation: The Shockwave of $250 Million in One Hour The cryptocurrency market is a wild ride, and sometimes, that ride takes a sharp turn downwards. In a recent dramatic turn of events, a staggering $250 million worth of crypto futures liquidation swept across major exchanges in just one hour. This rapid sell-off sent ripples through the digital asset landscape, highlighting the inherent volatility and high stakes involved in leveraged trading. Over the past 24 hours, the total figure climbed even higher, reaching an astonishing $776 million in liquidations. For many traders, this wasn‚Äôt just a market blip; it was a harsh reminder of how quickly fortunes can change in the fast-paced world of crypto futures. What Exactly is Crypto Futures Liquidation? If you‚Äôre new to the derivatives market, the term ‚Äúliquidation‚Äù might sound a bit intimidating. Simply put, a futures contract is an agreement to buy or sell an asset at a predetermined price on a specific future date. When you trade futures on an exchange, you often use leverage, meaning you only put up a fraction of the total trade value as collateral, known as margin. This allows you to control a larger position with less capital. However, leverage is a double-edged sword. If the market moves significantly against your leveraged position, your margin might no longer be enough to cover potential losses. When this happens, the exchange automatically closes your position to prevent further losses, and this forced closure is what we call crypto futures liquidation . It‚Äôs a protective mechanism for the exchange, but a painful experience for the trader who loses their collateral. The Staggering Numbers: $250 Million in an Hour ‚Äì What Does It Mean? To witness $250 million in crypto futures liquidation within a mere 60 minutes is a stark indicator of extreme market pressure. This kind of rapid liquidation event suggests a significant price movement that caught a large number of leveraged positions off guard. Often, it‚Äôs a cascading effect: one liquidation triggers another as prices dip further, leading to a domino effect of forced closures. Consider the broader context: the $776 million liquidated over 24 hours underscores sustained market volatility. These figures are not just numbers; they represent substantial capital wiped out from traders‚Äô accounts. Such events can amplify market downturns, as the forced selling adds more supply to the market, pushing prices even lower and trapping more leveraged positions. Why Does Crypto Futures Liquidation Happen So Suddenly? Several factors contribute to these sudden and massive crypto futures liquidation events: Extreme Volatility: Cryptocurrencies are notorious for their wild price swings. A small percentage change in Bitcoin or Ethereum can translate into a significant movement when leverage is applied. High Leverage Usage: Many traders in the crypto futures market use very high leverage (e.g., 50x, 100x). While this can magnify gains, it drastically reduces the margin for error, making liquidation thresholds much tighter. Market Whales and Large Orders: Large sell orders from institutional players or ‚Äúwhales‚Äù can quickly drive down prices, initiating a cascade of liquidations. Unexpected News or Events: Geopolitical events, regulatory announcements, or even a prominent figure‚Äôs tweet can trigger rapid market reactions, leading to widespread liquidations. These elements often combine to create a perfect storm, where a minor price dip can snowball into a major liquidation event, affecting hundreds of thousands of traders globally. Navigating the Storm: Strategies to Avoid Crypto Futures Liquidation While the crypto market will always have its volatile moments, traders can adopt strategies to minimize their risk of crypto futures liquidation . It‚Äôs about smart risk management and understanding the tools at your disposal. Manage Your Leverage Wisely: Avoid using excessively high leverage. While tempting, it significantly increases your risk. A lower leverage ratio provides more buffer against price fluctuations. Implement Stop-Loss Orders: Always set stop-loss orders. These automatically close your position if the price reaches a predetermined level, limiting your potential losses before liquidation occurs. Maintain Sufficient Margin: Ensure your account has enough collateral to withstand market swings. Don‚Äôt overextend yourself; always have a buffer beyond the minimum margin requirement. Stay Informed and Practice Due Diligence: Keep an eye on market news, technical analysis, and sentiment. Understanding potential catalysts for price movements can help you anticipate and react. Diversify (Where Possible): While futures trading is specific, having a broader portfolio can cushion the blow of a single market downturn. Understanding these principles is crucial for anyone venturing into the high-stakes world of crypto futures. It‚Äôs not just about making profits, but also about protecting your capital. Conclusion: The Enduring Lesson of Crypto Futures Liquidation The recent $250 million crypto futures liquidation serves as a powerful reminder of the inherent risks and rapid shifts within the cryptocurrency market. While futures trading offers immense opportunities for profit, it demands a disciplined approach to risk management. Understanding what triggers liquidations, and implementing strategies like judicious leverage and stop-loss orders, are not just good practices‚Äîthey are essential for survival and success. Always remember, the market doesn‚Äôt forgive recklessness. Trade wisely, stay informed, and prioritize capital preservation above all else. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) 1. What exactly is crypto futures liquidation? It‚Äôs the automatic closure of a trader‚Äôs leveraged position by an exchange when their margin (collateral) falls below a required level due to adverse market movements, preventing further losses for the exchange. 2. Why did $250 million worth of futures get liquidated so quickly? Such rapid liquidations are typically triggered by extreme market volatility, often combined with widespread use of high leverage. A significant price swing can quickly push many leveraged positions past their liquidation threshold, creating a cascade effect. 3. How does leverage contribute to liquidations? Leverage amplifies both potential gains and losses. While it allows traders to control larger positions with less capital, it also drastically reduces the price movement required to wipe out their initial margin, making liquidation more likely. 4. What can traders do to avoid crypto futures liquidation? Key strategies include using lower leverage, setting strict stop-loss orders, maintaining sufficient margin in your trading account, staying informed about market news, and practicing overall disciplined risk management. 5. Are liquidations always bad for the market? While painful for the liquidated traders, liquidations are a natural part of leveraged markets. They can sometimes clear out excessive speculation, potentially leading to healthier, more sustainable price action in the long run, though short-term they can intensify downturns. Did this article shed light on the recent market events for you? Share your thoughts and insights with your fellow traders! Spread the knowledge on social media to help others understand the dynamics of crypto futures liquidation and trade more safely. Your shares help us continue providing valuable market analysis. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin and Ethereum price action. This post Crypto Futures Liquidation: The Shockwave of $250 Million in One Hour first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Stream Finance halts withdrawals after $93M loss and xUSD depeg
body: Stream Finance, a yield-focused DeFi platform, has suspended deposits and withdrawals after an external fund manager disclosed a $93 million loss in platform assets. According to an X post from the project during the early hours of November 4, one of the project‚Äôs third-party fund managers reported the loss over the weekend, which led to a sharp depeg of its stablecoin and a halt in user activity. Stream Finance @StreamDefi ¬∑ Follow Yesterday, an external fund manager overseeing Stream funds disclosed the loss of approximately $93 million in Stream fund assets.In response, Stream is in the process of engaging Keith Miller and Joseph Cutler of the law firm Perkins Coie LLP, to lead a comprehensive 9:25 am ¬∑ 4 Nov 2025 10 Reply Copy link Read more on Twitter ‚ÄúWe are actively withdrawing all liquid assets and expect this process to be completed in the near term,‚Äù the project wrote on X, adding that it has retained law firm Perkins Coie to lead an investigation into the incident. Stream Finance has pledged to publish a detailed post-mortem and continue updating the public as its investigation progresses. xUSD loses dollar peg Stream Finance is a recursive looping DeFi protocol that uses layered yield strategies and third-party fund managers to generate returns and collateralise its stablecoin, xUSD. However, as unease spread over the weekend after users noticed stalled withdrawals and xUSD slipping from its peg, the platform‚Äôs complex yield mechanisms and reliance on off-chain fund managers came under renewed scrutiny. Before the team issued its official statement, users had already begun sounding alarms about stalled transactions and a sudden drop in xUSD‚Äôs price across decentralized exchanges. The stablecoin, which was designed to maintain a $1 peg, fell to as low as $0.51 on Monday, as market confidence in the protocol‚Äôs underlying collateral and risk exposure faded. At press time, xUSD is down over 76% in the past 24 hours, trading at $0.2973. xUSD price action in the past 24 hours. Source: Coingecko. Prominent DeFi voices, including Chaos Labs founder Omer Goldberg and trader CBB0FE, were among the first to highlight that xUSD had already ‚Äúmaterially depegged‚Äù hours before Stream Finance acknowledged the situation. Goldberg also drew connections between the timing of the depeg and a separate exploit that hit the automated market maker Balancer just days earlier. The Balancer incident , which involved a vulnerability resulting in a $100 million loss, may have prompted investors to rapidly pull funds from protocols perceived to be exposed or poorly collateralized. At the same time, community members have also questioned the discrepancies between the platform‚Äôs self-reported total value locked (TVL) and data available on DeFiLlama, where Stream‚Äôs looping strategies were not recognized as valid TVL due to concerns about inflated figures. Stream itself acknowledged this difference in a Friday post , stating that user deposits totalled around $160 million while total deployed assets exceeded $500 million, raising questions about leverage and collateral adequacy. ‚ÄúWe have signed letters of engagement with third-party attestation companies and have shared access to our books. These things take time to do right, but we are moving as fast as we can to give users guarantees,‚Äù it said at the time. In its Nov. 4 update, Stream Finance said it is actively working to recover all liquid assets and noted that no new deposits would be processed during the ongoing review. The post Stream Finance halts withdrawals after $93M loss and xUSD depeg appeared first on Invezz

title: Cathie Wood Doubles Down on Bullish, Snapping Up Another $12M in Shares ‚Äî What Does Ark Know?
body: Cathie Wood‚Äôs Ark Invest is increasing its bet on Bullish Holdings, the crypto exchange backed by billionaire Peter Thiel, with a new $11.98 million share purchase this week. The latest buy marks Ark‚Äôs continued accumulation of Bullish stock (BLSH) following its public debut in August. According to Ark‚Äôs Monday trading disclosure, the investment firm acquired a total of 238,346 Bullish shares across three of its actively managed exchange-traded funds. The flagship ARK Innovation ETF (ARKK) picked up 164,214 shares, the ARK Next Generation Internet ETF (ARKW) bought 49,056 shares, and the ARK Fintech Innovation ETF (ARKF) added 25,076 shares. Together, the purchases bring Ark‚Äôs total investment in Bullish to more than $209 million since the exchange went public. Ark Invest Keeps Faith in Bullish, Boosting Exposure After Exchange‚Äôs U.S. Expansion Bullish shares now make up 0.97% of ARKK, 0.98% of ARKW, and 1.18% of ARKF. The addition comes despite recent volatility; Bullish stock (BLSH) traded nearly flat on Monday, closing 0.61% lower at $50.26. The stock has declined 22.45% in the past month and remains down roughly 47% from its August debut. Ark initially invested $172 million in Bullish shares during the company‚Äôs New York Stock Exchange listing at $37 per share. ‚Çø Cathie Wood's Ark Invest has purchased $172 million worth of Peter Thiel-backed Bullish shares across three of its ETFs. #ArkInvest #Bullish #IPO https://t.co/iOrY7mPvdr ‚Äî Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) August 14, 2025 The August offering, one of the largest crypto IPOs of 2025, valued Bullish at around $5.4 billion and raised $1.1 billion through the sale of 30 million shares. Ark and BlackRock both expressed early interest in the deal, showing institutional confidence in Bullish‚Äôs exchange model and regulatory footing. Founded in 2021 and headquartered in the Cayman Islands, Bullish combines centralized infrastructure with blockchain-based transparency. The exchange targets institutional and professional traders and has processed more than $1.5 trillion in cumulative trading volume since launch. @Bullish has officially entered the US market, launching operations in 20 states after securing a BitLicense license from New York regulators. #Bullish #Crypto https://t.co/TptCTqbVYp ‚Äî Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) October 2, 2025 In September, Bullish secured both the BitLicense and Money Transmission License from the New York State Department of Financial Services, a key milestone that allowed it to launch spot trading across 20 U.S. states, including New York, California, and Florida. Will Ark‚Äôs Bullish Bet Pay Off or Repeat the Pain of 2022? Bullish‚Äôs strong regulatory momentum has coincided with improving financials. The exchange reported a net profit of $108.3 million in the second quarter of 2025 , reversing a $116.4 million loss a year earlier. @Bullish has reported a net profit of $108.3 million for Q2 2025, marking a major turnaround from a $116.4 million loss. #Crypto #Bullish https://t.co/AWdqt2ELc1 ‚Äî Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) September 18, 2025 Adjusted revenue for the period came in at $57 million, down from $67 million in the prior year, while trading volume reached $179.6 billion. The company is scheduled to release its third-quarter earnings on November 19. Ark‚Äôs latest purchase aligns with its long-standing strategy of investing in what it calls ‚Äúdisruptive innovation.‚Äù The firm manages more than $16 billion in assets and focuses on high-growth sectors, including artificial intelligence, robotics, genomics, and blockchain technology. Source: Stockcircle The ARK Innovation ETF, Ark‚Äôs flagship fund with $8.4 billion in assets, is heavily weighted toward technology and crypto-linked companies. Its top holdings include Tesla (12.32%), Coinbase (5.86%), Roku (5.73%), and Robinhood (4.8%). Bullish‚Äôs growing presence in the portfolio signals Ark‚Äôs confidence in the exchange‚Äôs role within the evolving digital asset ecosystem. Ark‚Äôs crypto-related exposure across its main ETFs, ARKK, ARKW, and ARKF, now exceeds $2.15 billion, covering equities like Coinbase, Robinhood, and Circle Internet Group, as well as direct holdings via the ARK 21Shares Bitcoin ETF (ARKB). As of Oct. 31, the flagship Ark Innovation ETF (ARKK) is up 54.5% year to date, far outpacing the S&P 500‚Äôs gain of 16.3%. Wood‚Äôs remarkable 153% return in 2020 helped build her reputation and attract loyal followers. Her strategy can lead to sharp gains during bull markets but also painful losses, as seen in 2022, when ARKK dropped by more than 60%. The post Cathie Wood Doubles Down on Bullish, Snapping Up Another $12M in Shares ‚Äî What Does Ark Know? appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: Chainlink DvP Settlement: A Revolutionary Leap in Global Digital Finance
body: BitcoinWorld Chainlink DvP Settlement: A Revolutionary Leap in Global Digital Finance A groundbreaking moment in global digital finance has just unfolded! The world of cryptocurrencies and traditional banking is increasingly converging, and at the forefront of this evolution is the remarkable Chainlink DvP Settlement . This innovative development signals a significant step forward in how international transactions are conducted, bringing unprecedented efficiency and security to cross-border payments. What is the Chainlink DvP Settlement and Why Does it Matter? Recently, Chainlink announced its pivotal role in facilitating a Delivery versus Payment (DvP) settlement between the Central Bank of Brazil and the Hong Kong Monetary Authority. This isn‚Äôt just a technical achievement; it‚Äôs a testament to the power of blockchain technology in bridging traditional financial systems with decentralized networks. A DvP settlement ensures that the transfer of securities (like bonds or stocks) and the corresponding payment occur simultaneously. This critical mechanism eliminates counterparty risk, meaning neither party has to worry about sending their asset or payment without receiving the other. Chainlink‚Äôs involvement brings the robust security and transparency of its decentralized oracle networks to this essential process. Key participants in this landmark Chainlink DvP Settlement included: Standard Chartered Banco Inter The Global Shipping Business Network 7COMm These entities represent a diverse group, from established banks to innovative tech firms, highlighting the collaborative nature of this initiative and its broad impact. How Does Chainlink Enhance Global Financial Efficiency? The successful execution of this cross-border DvP settlement, powered by Chainlink, holds immense implications for the future of international trade and finance. It demonstrably shows how real-world assets can be tokenized and exchanged securely and efficiently across different jurisdictions. Furthermore, it paves the way for a more integrated and reliable global financial infrastructure. The benefits of such a system are clear and compelling: Reduced Risk: Simultaneous exchange minimizes the chance of one party defaulting, offering greater security. Increased Efficiency: Automated processes significantly speed up settlement times, potentially transforming days into mere minutes. Enhanced Transparency: Blockchain‚Äôs immutable ledger provides a clear, verifiable record of all transactions. Lower Costs: Streamlined operations and reduced intermediaries can lead to substantial cost savings for financial institutions and their clients. This initiative helps simplify the complexities of cross-border payments. The Chainlink DvP Settlement acts as a secure conduit, ensuring that value moves seamlessly and safely across international borders. What‚Äôs the Connection to Brazil‚Äôs Digital Currency Project? This isn‚Äôt Chainlink‚Äôs first collaboration with the Central Bank of Brazil. As Bitcoin World previously reported in November 2024, the Central Bank of Brazil (BCB) had launched the second phase of its Drex digital currency (CBDC) project, with Chainlink participating in the pilot. This prior collaboration laid crucial groundwork for the recent DvP success, demonstrating Chainlink‚Äôs consistent involvement in Brazil‚Äôs digital finance evolution. The Drex project aims to create a digital version of the Brazilian Real, leveraging blockchain technology for enhanced financial services. Chainlink‚Äôs role in both the Drex pilot and this DvP settlement underscores its importance in connecting CBDCs and other digital assets with external data and off-chain systems. This connectivity is absolutely vital for the widespread adoption and utility of digital currencies, providing the necessary infrastructure for their real-world application. What Does This Chainlink DvP Settlement Mean for the Future? The success of the Brazil-Hong Kong Chainlink DvP Settlement serves as a powerful proof of concept. It illustrates the immense potential for decentralized oracle networks to facilitate complex financial operations on a truly global scale. Consequently, we can anticipate more central banks and financial institutions exploring similar solutions to modernize their payment systems. This development is not just about payments; it‚Äôs about building a programmable financial system where smart contracts can execute agreements automatically and reliably. Chainlink‚Äôs secure data feeds and interoperability solutions are key enablers for this future, allowing various blockchain networks and traditional systems to communicate seamlessly and securely. As the digital asset landscape continues to mature, the demand for robust, secure, and interoperable infrastructure will only grow. The Chainlink DvP Settlement exemplifies how innovation can drive real-world utility and reshape the very foundations of global commerce. A Glimpse into Tomorrow‚Äôs Global Finance In conclusion, the successful Chainlink DvP Settlement between Brazil and Hong Kong is a landmark achievement. It showcases the transformative power of decentralized oracle networks in creating a more efficient, secure, and transparent global financial system. By reducing risks and increasing speed, Chainlink is not just supporting transactions; it‚Äôs actively shaping the future of cross-border finance. This is a clear indicator of how blockchain technology, specifically Chainlink‚Äôs capabilities, is moving from theoretical potential to practical, impactful applications that benefit everyone involved. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) 1. What is a Delivery versus Payment (DvP) settlement? A DvP settlement is a mechanism that ensures the simultaneous exchange of two assets, typically securities and cash. This process guarantees that neither party can default on their obligation without the other receiving their part, thereby eliminating counterparty risk. 2. Why did Chainlink participate in this settlement? Chainlink provided its decentralized oracle network to securely connect the on-chain digital assets with off-chain data and systems, ensuring the integrity, transparency, and automation of the DvP settlement process between the Central Bank of Brazil and the Hong Kong Monetary Authority. 3. What other entities were involved in the Brazil-Hong Kong DvP settlement? Beyond the central banks, other key participants included Standard Chartered, Banco Inter, the Global Shipping Business Network, and 7COMm, highlighting a broad collaboration across traditional finance and tech sectors. 4. How does this Chainlink DvP Settlement relate to Brazil‚Äôs Drex CBDC project? Chainlink has also been a participant in the pilot phase of Brazil‚Äôs Drex digital currency (CBDC) project. This prior involvement demonstrates Chainlink‚Äôs ongoing role in supporting Brazil‚Äôs digital finance initiatives and connecting CBDCs to broader financial ecosystems. 5. What are the main benefits of this Chainlink DvP Settlement? The primary benefits include significantly reduced counterparty risk, increased efficiency through automated processes, enhanced transparency via blockchain‚Äôs immutable ledger, and potential cost savings for international transactions. If you found this insight into Chainlink‚Äôs groundbreaking role in global finance compelling, share this article with your network! Help us spread the word about the future of digital settlements and the power of blockchain technology in shaping a more connected financial world. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Chainlink institutional adoption. This post Chainlink DvP Settlement: A Revolutionary Leap in Global Digital Finance first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: From Greed To Terror: Bitcoin‚Äôs Fall Below $104K Sparks Extreme Fear
body: Bitcoin‚Äôs pullback on Monday sent a quick chill through crypto markets, pulling sentiment down to levels not seen in months. Prices dipped to a 24-hour low of $103,938 after earlier trading above $109,000, and gauges of market mood turned sharply negative as investors reassessed risk. Related Reading: Bitcoin May Be This Week‚Äôs Big Story As Saylor Teases Fresh Buy Crypto Fear Hits Extreme Readings According to the Crypto Fear & Greed Index, the score fell to 21 out of 100 on Tuesday, a move that registers as ‚ÄúExtreme Fear.‚Äù That mark is the lowest in nearly seven months; the index previously hit 18 out of 100 on April 9, when markets reacted to US President Donald Trump‚Äôs global tariff measures. Reports have disclosed that the index has been swinging between calm and alarm since the large sell-off in early October, when readings tumbled after prices slid from a peak above $126,000 on Oct. 6. Market participants pointed to a mix of weak institutional flows and macro worries. Based on reports, Bitcoin-tied exchange-traded funds recorded net outflows of nearly $800 million last week. Analysts said institutional buying recently fell below the amount of newly mined Bitcoin for the first time in seven months. Those trends reduce the steady inflows that had helped support prices. Price Action & Short-Term Drivers Bitcoin recovered above $104,100 after the low, but the sharp intraday swing highlighted fragility. Some traders blamed cooling activity on exchanges and wallets, while others flagged concerns about the Federal Reserve‚Äôs stance. The Fed cut interest rates for the second time this year on Wednesday, yet signaled there may not be more cuts in 2025. That hint of a less-accommodating outlook appeared to catch investors off guard, prompting quick re-pricing in both stock and crypto markets. There are also technical points at play. The Crypto Fear & Greed Index last fell into the ‚ÄúExtreme Fear‚Äù zone on Oct. 21 when it hit 25 out of 100, after Bitcoin slid from over $110,000 to below $108,000. Earlier, the index had topped 70 ‚Äî a ‚ÄúGreed‚Äù reading ‚Äî showing how fast sentiment can flip when price moves accelerate. Related Reading: Forget Billions‚ÄîXRP Could Hit Trillions, Leading Expert Says What Traders Are Watching Next Traders will be watching ETF flows, on-chain activity, and any fresh signals from US policymakers. Based on reports, lower blockchain activity and fewer large buys by institutions have been cited as immediate reasons for the decline. If inflows return, they could stabilize the market. If outflows continue, the pressure may deepen. Market bulls, however, still point to seasonal history. According to historical patterns cited by some analysts, November has often been a strong month for Bitcoin, with average gains above 40% in past years. Featured image from Gemini, chart from TradingView

title: Wintermute Denies Binance Lawsuit Plans Amid Market Maker Rumors
body: Wintermute founder Evgeny Gaevoy has dismissed widespread speculation that his firm intends to sue Binance over losses from October‚Äôs historic crypto crash, stating ‚Äú literally nothing changed ‚Äù since his earlier clarifications and the company never had such plans. The clarification comes after days of social media speculation linking the market maker to potential litigation over auto-deleveraging executions during the October 10-11 flash crash that liquidated $19 billion in positions and briefly erased $600 billion from the crypto market cap. literally nothing changed since this tweet and we never had plans to sue binance, nor see any reason to do it in future I should probably ask to make a note of all the people spreading baseless rumors, but most of people believing these have goldfish memory capacity, so I wont https://t.co/0oHShby0Uk ‚Äî wishful_cynic (@EvgenyGaevoy) November 3, 2025 Gaevoy labeled the rumors as ‚Äú larp ‚Äù when directly asked whether he had signed a non-disclosure agreement with Binance or coordinated with other market makers to pursue joint legal action. Former Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao amplified the denial by quote-tweeting Gaevoy‚Äôs post, writing, ‚Äú If someone made you believe otherwise, it‚Äôs time to click unfollow. ‚Äú October Crash Stir ADL Controversy The October 10 selloff was triggered by President Donald Trump‚Äôs announcement of 100% tariffs on Chinese imports , creating panic across global markets. Bitcoin plummeted to $104,782 during the 48-hour period, while Ethereum and major altcoins lost between 15% and 20% of their value. Binance‚Äôs trading infrastructure buckled under the strain, with API failures returning HTTP 503 errors and Reduce-Only orders being rejected during peak volatility. The exchange‚Äôs Auto-Deleveraging mechanism was activated, resulting in short liquidations at prices up to five times the prevailing market rates. Binance spent $188 million from its insurance fund and issued $283 million in refunds for oracle-related depegs , though ADL losses were excluded from compensation. Gaevoy had previously stated in a video that Wintermute was ‚Äú ADL‚Äôd at completely ridiculous prices ‚Äù and mentioned that the firm was evaluating legal options. These remarks fueled speculation about the lawsuit. Wintermute CEO @EvgenyGaevoy on how they got ADL‚Äôd on Binance and predicts lawsuits and challenges from trading firms. pic.twitter.com/d2hGXoOOHc ‚Äî cryptotesters (@cryptotesters) October 20, 2025 On-chain analysis of Wintermute‚Äôs 10 tracked wallets across Ethereum, Arbitrum, and Solana revealed a 12% decline in the portfolio, dropping from $637 million to $572 million. No large withdrawals exceeding $10 million or liquidation patterns involving Aave or Compound were detected; however, a single 1,000 BTC inflow worth approximately $61 million occurred on October 4, just days before the crash. Market Structure Under Scrutiny The October event exposed structural vulnerabilities in crypto derivatives markets, where notional liquidation figures vastly overstate actual capital losses. Speaking with Cryptonews, Sam Seo, chairman of the Kaia DLT Foundation, said the actual capital lost by traders is likely ‚Äú in the range of 5% to 15% of the headline number, ‚Äù translating to between $950 million and $2.85 billion in real losses. He warned that ‚Äú the remaining 85-95% was simply phantom leverage, synthetic exposure that was rapidly unwound. ‚Äú Most people on Crypto Twitter freaked out over the $19B in liquidations. But real trader losses are far smaller than that, may be only 15% of the total figure. #CryptoCrash #Liquidations #BTC https://t.co/d0IJDFeaNC ‚Äî Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) October 17, 2025 Bitcoin futures open interest collapsed by more than 30% during the selloff, erasing over $10 billion in notional positions in one of the largest single-day declines on record, comparable to the May 2021 liquidation and the FTX unwind in 2022. Patrick Heusser, head of lending and TradFi at Sentora, also explained that ‚Äú liquidations [are] a speedometer for deleveraging intensity, not a profit and loss statement, ‚Äù noting that exchanges settle these events using margin and insurance funds. Despite the chaos, Bitcoin recovered to $114,000 by October 13, supported by $420 million in spot ETF inflows that helped stabilize prices. ‚ÄòUptober‚Äô Turns Red for First Time Since 2018 According to Reuters , October marked Bitcoin‚Äôs first monthly loss since 2018, snapping a seven-year winning streak and ending nearly 5% lower for the month despite reaching an all-time high above $126,000 just days before the crash. The reversal came as broader risk appetite weakened, with Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell pushing back against market expectations for continued rate cuts and a government shutdown blocking crucial economic data. Analyst Scott Melker has earlier called Bitcoin‚Äôs resilience ‚Äú a small miracle ‚Äù after the liquidation , stating ‚Äú I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôre entering a bear market ‚Äù and noting ‚Äú this isn‚Äôt 2017. Nor is it 2021. What happened last week was purely structural. ‚Äú Bitcoin opened November trading at $106,961 , down 0.7% as whale profit-taking and continued ETF outflows pressured prices below $107,000. For the first time in seven months, institutional demand has fallen below the pace of new coin issuance, indicating that large buyers are stepping back. Source: X/@caprioleio Markets now price a roughly 70% chance of a 25-basis-point Fed rate cut in December, down from 94% a week earlier, as policymakers deliver mixed signals on growth and inflation. Analysts remain cautiously optimistic that November could restore typical seasonal strength, as Bitcoin has historically averaged returns exceeding 40% during the month. Speaking with Cryptonews, MEXC Research Chief Analyst Shawn Young noted that ‚Äú accumulation of coins by major market participants, the trade agreement between Washington and Beijing, and moderately positive stock market performance are paving the way for a possible recovery in November. ‚Äú VALR CEO Farzam Ehsani also warned that the market structure remains fragile, stating, ‚Äú any change in the Fed‚Äôs tone or a new round of geopolitical tension could dramatically shift the balance of power, ‚Äù keeping Bitcoin likely range-bound between $107,000 and $113,000 as participants await clearer macro signals. The post Wintermute Denies Binance Lawsuit Plans Amid Market Maker Rumors appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley warn of potential 20% market decline
body: Two major Wall Street firms told investors on Tuesday to prepare for a potential drop in stock prices over the next couple of years, even as markets around the world continue to reach new heights. Speaking at an investment conference in Hong Kong, the chief executives of Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley said they expect markets to pull back at some point soon, though they emphasized such drops are a regular part of investing. Stock markets across the globe have been climbing higher throughout this year. Investors have been excited about artificial intelligence technology and hoped central banks would lower interest rates. In recent weeks, major American stock indexes have reached all-time highs. Japan‚Äôs Nikkei 225 and South Korea‚Äôs Kospi have also set new records. In China, the Shanghai Composite has climbed to its best level in ten years, helped by improving relations between Washington and Beijing and a weaker U.S. dollar. David Solomon, who leads Goldman Sachs, told attendees at the Global Financial Leaders‚Äô Investment Summit that markets will probably fall between 10 to 20% sometime in the next 12 to 24 months. ‚ÄúThings run, and then they pull back so people can reassess,‚Äù Solomon said as quoted by CNBC. Not a cause for alarm, executives say But Solomon made clear that such drops should not worry long-term investors. He said Goldman Sachs continues to tell its clients to keep their money in the market and review how their investments are spread out, rather than trying to guess when prices will rise or fall. ‚ÄúA 10 to 15% drawdown happens often, even through positive market cycles,‚Äù he explained . ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not something that changes your fundamental, your structural belief as to how you want to allocate capital.‚Äù Ted Pick, the head of Morgan Stanley, shared similar thoughts during the same discussion. He said investors should actually see temporary declines as a good thing, not a warning sign of trouble ahead. ‚ÄúWe should also welcome the possibility that there would be drawdowns, 10 to 15% drawdowns that are not driven by some sort of macro cliff effect,‚Äù Pick said. The two executives are not alone in their concerns. The International Monetary Fund recently warned that markets could experience a sudden sharp drop . Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell and Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey have also raised concerns about stock prices being too high. Asian markets show promise Despite these warnings about a possible pullback, both Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley see good opportunities in Asian markets over the coming years. They pointed to recent positive changes, including the trade agreement between the United States and China. Solomon said Goldman Sachs believes investors worldwide will keep putting money into China, calling it one of the ‚Äúlargest and most important economies‚Äù globally. Pick said Morgan Stanley feels positive about Hong Kong, China, Japan and India because each has its own unique story of economic growth. He specifically mentioned Japan‚Äôs efforts to improve how companies are run and India‚Äôs major spending on infrastructure as investment opportunities that could play out over several years. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs hard not to be excited about Hong Kong, China, Japan and India ‚Äî three vastly different narratives, but all part of a global Asia story,‚Äù Pick said. He particularly highlighted China‚Äôs artificial intelligence, electric vehicle and biotechnology industries as areas worth watching. As reported by Cryptopolitan Southeast Asian markets are also drawing increased attention from global investors looking for alternatives as trade dynamics shift worldwide. title: Egrag Crypto to XRP Investors: Choose Your Targets Wisely. Here‚Äôs why
body: Crypto market analyst Egrag Crypto has released a detailed chart analysis emphasizing a pivotal moment for XRP‚Äôs price structure. His latest projection, based on long-term technical patterns, outlines potential price targets ranging from conservative to highly optimistic levels, while identifying $2.08 as a key threshold that could determine the next market direction. #XRP ‚Äì Choose Your Targets Wisely : When it comes to #XRP , let‚Äôs keep it simple and real, As long as price doesn‚Äôt close below $2.08, every other indicator out there is lying or lagging. Price Action is the ultimate truth-teller: True technical analysts know one fact‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/ST6dKfOzjt ‚Äî EGRAG CRYPTO (@egragcrypto) November 2, 2025 Focus on Price Action and Market Structure Egrag‚Äôs analysis, presented through a ‚ÄúW-pattern‚Äù framework, underscores the idea that price movement itself is the most reliable signal in technical analysis. He argues that as long as XRP‚Äôs price does not close below $2.08, broader market indicators or oscillators should not dictate sentiment. According to the chart, this price acts as the compression point within the asset‚Äôs multi-year structure, suggesting it could serve as a technical foundation for the next potential rally. The visual shows a long-term formation resembling a double-bottom or ‚ÄúW10‚Äù pattern, with XRP consolidating around its neckline. From this base, Egrag outlines three potential scenarios: a conservative target near $13, an average projection around $22, and an optimistic scenario extending to approximately $35.21. These projections appear to derive from measured moves calculated from historical trend symmetry and structural breakout potential. We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 Community Reactions and Broader Implications Following the release of Egrag‚Äôs post, several community members offered their views on the outlined structure and its implications. One market participant, Rene David, stated that his targets have remained between $17 and $34 for an extended period and that he sees no reason to revise them. Another user, Jeremy Merrell Williams, interpreted the $2.08 level as a compression zone between retail speculation and institutional migration. He linked the technical to developments such as Hidden Road , RLUSD , and XLS-66 lending, suggesting these elements could form the infrastructure for multi-trillion-dollar settlement volumes on the XRP Ledger. Egrag Crypto‚Äôs latest chart places renewed focus on XRP‚Äôs price structure and the significance of its $2.08 threshold. The analysis integrates traditional technical patterns with the current market context, emphasizing the primacy of price action as a validation tool. Whether XRP sustains its level above that mark could determine if the asset transitions into the next phase of structural expansion or remains in consolidation. For analysts and traders observing the market, the $2.08 level now stands as a critical reference point in the evolving technical outlook for XRP. title: Why Is Crypto Down Today? ‚Äì November 4, 2025
body: The cryptocurrency market is trading lower today, with total market capitalization down 3.9% to $3.54 trillion, according to data from CoinMarketCap. However, 24-hour trading volume rose to $223 billion, indicating a slight uptick in activity despite the market-wide decline. TLDR: The global crypto market cap dropped 3.9% to $3.54T; 9 of the top 10 coins fell; BTC -2.8% to $104,577, ETH -6.4% to $3,493; Fear & Greed Index plunged to 27 (Fear) from 36 yesterday; BTC ETFs saw $186.5M outflows; ETH ETFs recorded $135.76M outflows; SOL ETFs bucked the trend with $70.05M inflows; Strategy announced a Euro-denominated preferred stock offering to fund more Bitcoin buys; FTX withdrew its plan to restrict repayments in 49 jurisdictions after creditor backlash. Crypto Winners & Losers At the time of writing, 9 of the top 10 cryptocurrencies are in the red over the past 24 hours. Bitcoin (BTC) slid 2.8% to $104,577, holding a market cap of about $2.08 trillion. Ethereum (ETH) fell 6.4% to $3,493, while BNB (BNB) lost 8.3%, now trading at $946. XRP (XRP) dropped 6.7% to $2.25, and Solana (SOL) suffered one of the steepest declines among majors, down 11.0% to $157. Dogecoin (DOGE) slipped 6.6% to $0.1625, while Cardano (ADA) extended losses to $0.5349, down 7.4% in the past 24 hours. Despite the downturn, a few altcoins stood out with remarkable gains. Jelly-My-Jelly (JMJ) surged 183.3%, followed by Decred (DCR) with a 150% jump, and Zcash (ZEC) up 19.4%. Meanwhile, trending tokens included Dash , Decred , and Zcash , reflecting renewed interest in privacy and masternode-based cryptocurrencies amid heightened volatility. Meanwhile, Michael Saylor‚Äôs Bitcoin-focused firm, Strategy, has announced plans to launch a Euro-denominated credit instrument under the ticker STRE, marking its first-ever issuance aimed at European and global institutional investors. Strategy is offering $STRE (‚ÄúStream‚Äù), our first ever Euro-Denominated Perpetual Preferred Stock, to European and global institutional investors. $MSTR pic.twitter.com/tCectc2uA2 ‚Äî Michael Saylor (@saylor) November 3, 2025 The company intends to offer 3.5 million shares of its 10% Series A Perpetual Preferred Stock, with proceeds earmarked for general corporate use and additional Bitcoin acquisitions. The announcement coincides with Strategy‚Äôs latest Bitcoin purchase of 397 BTC worth $45.6 million made between October 27 and November 2. Bitcoin Slips Below $107K as ETF Outflows and Whale Selling Pressure Market Bitcoin dropped 2% in early Asian trading, sliding below $107,000 amid continued ETF outflows and profit-taking by large holders. The move extended the market‚Äôs cautious tone from late October‚Äôs $19 billion washout, with traders viewing the pullback as consolidation after a volatile stretch. On-chain data shows institutional accumulation has slowed, with inflows falling below new Bitcoin issuance for the first time in seven months, according to Capriole Investments founder Charles Edwards. The shift reflects a broader risk-off tone as equities advanced, led by tech gains and Amazon‚Äôs OpenAI deal, while the dollar strengthened on reduced expectations for rapid US rate cuts. Won't lie, this was the main metric keeping me bullish the last months while every other asset outperformed Bitcoin. The trend could flip tomorrow, next week, or in 2 years. But right now we have 188 treasury companies carrying heavy bags with no business model and a lot less‚Ä¶ https://t.co/ECTv3Klbmf ‚Äî Charles Edwards (@caprioleio) November 3, 2025 Analysts say October‚Äôs correction flushed out excessive leverage, leaving the market in a rebuilding phase. SynFutures CEO Rachel Lin noted that long-term holders remain steady and exchange outflows persist, which is typically a positive sign. For now, the market is expected to trade sideways as traders watch ETF flows and Fed signals, with a softer inflation print potentially reigniting buying momentum later this month. Levels & Events to Watch Next At the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $104,370, down 2.04% on the day. The asset has extended its pullback after losing support near the $107,000 level, with intraday sentiment turning defensive. BTC is currently fluctuating between $104,000 and $106,000, a range that suggests consolidation following recent sell pressure. A decisive move above $106,500 could pave the way for a rebound toward $109,000 and $112,000, where prior resistance has capped gains. On the downside, a break below $103,500 could expose the market to deeper losses, with the next notable support seen around $101,000‚Äì$100,000, a key psychological zone watched by traders. Meanwhile, Ethereum trades at $3,477, down 3.48% over the past 24 hours. The coin has weakened after repeatedly failing to hold above $3,700, suggesting sellers remain in control. If ETH reclaims $3,550, it may attempt a rebound toward $3,750‚Äì$3,900. However, a drop below $3,450 could open the door to a sharper correction toward $3,300‚Äì$3,250, where stronger buying support previously emerged. Meanwhile, market sentiment has turned sharply bearish, with the Crypto Fear and Greed Index dropping to 27 , signaling ‚ÄúFear.‚Äù The index stood at 36 yesterday, 42 last week, and 59 a month ago, reflecting a consistent erosion in investor confidence as crypto prices continue to fall. The steep decline underscores the market‚Äôs growing caution, with traders reducing exposure amid volatile price action and fading risk appetite. The US spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) recorded $186.5 million in outflows on November 3, signaling renewed selling pressure across institutional products, according to data from SoSoValue. The cumulative total net inflow now stands at $61.0 billion, with combined net assets valued at $143.5 billion, accounting for 6.75% of Bitcoin‚Äôs market capitalization. Total trading volume for the day reached $4.69 billion, reflecting continued activity despite the broader market downturn. Among individual issuers, BlackRock‚Äôs IBIT led the outflows with $186.5 million, while Fidelity‚Äôs FBTC, Grayscale‚Äôs GBTC, and Ark & 21Shares‚Äô ARKB posted no new inflows. Despite the pullback, BlackRock‚Äôs fund remains dominant with $85.3 billion in total assets, followed by Fidelity‚Äôs $21.8 billion and Grayscale‚Äôs $18.2 billion. Spot Ethereum ETFs also saw $135.76 million in outflows on November 3. Among the nine listed ETFs, BlackRock‚Äôs ETHA recorded the largest outflow of $81.7 million, followed by Fidelity‚Äôs FETH with $25.1 million, and Grayscale‚Äôs ETHE with $15 million. Other issuers, including Bitwise, VanEck, and 21Shares, also reported smaller redemptions as institutional sentiment cooled alongside Ethereum‚Äôs market pullback. The total cumulative net inflow now stands at $14.23 billion, while total net assets dropped to $24.02 billion, representing 5.55% of Ethereum‚Äôs market capitalization. Daily trading volume across all funds reached $2.51 billion, reflecting high turnover amid declining prices. In contrast, spot Solana ETFs saw $70.05 million in net inflows on November 3, marking their fourth consecutive day of positive flows, according to data from SoSoValue. The total cumulative net inflow now stands at $269.26 million, with total net assets reaching $513.35 million, representing 0.57% of Solana‚Äôs market capitalization. Total trading value for the day amounted to $67.59 million. Among the two listed ETFs, Bitwise‚Äôs BSOL dominated with $65.16 million in inflows, while Grayscale‚Äôs GSOL added $4.9 million. Meanwhile, FTX has abandoned its controversial proposal to limit repayments in dozens of countries after sharp opposition from creditors, particularly those in China. @FTX_Official withdrew its plan to restrict repayments in 49 jurisdictions after backlash from creditors, especially those in China. #FTX #Crypto https://t.co/C2CHGadN2K ‚Äî Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) November 4, 2025 The post Why Is Crypto Down Today? ‚Äì November 4, 2025 appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: AI Cloud Capacity: Microsoft‚Äôs Strategic $9.7 Billion IREN Deal Unleashes Future Potential
body: BitcoinWorld AI Cloud Capacity: Microsoft‚Äôs Strategic $9.7 Billion IREN Deal Unleashes Future Potential In the rapidly evolving world where digital innovation intersects with the booming demand for artificial intelligence, securing robust infrastructure is paramount. For many in the cryptocurrency space, the name IREN might evoke memories of bitcoin mining operations. However, this Australian firm has made a pivotal shift, now standing at the forefront of the AI cloud capacity race. This transformation is highlighted by a monumental $9.7 billion, five-year contract with Microsoft, a deal that not only underscores the tech giant‚Äôs aggressive pursuit of AI dominance but also showcases the lucrative pivot for companies like IREN. This article delves into the intricacies of this landmark agreement, its implications for the AI landscape, and what it means for the future of cloud computing. The Strategic Alliance: Microsoft‚Äôs Quest for Enhanced AI Compute Microsoft is leaving no stone unturned in its quest to secure more compute capacity for meeting its customers‚Äô heavy demand for AI services. The Redmond-based tech giant recently signed a substantial $9.7 billion, five-year contract with Australia‚Äôs IREN, formally known as Iris Energy, to secure further AI cloud capacity . This strategic partnership is a clear indication of the escalating competition among tech behemoths to establish a dominant position in the artificial intelligence sector. The deal will give Microsoft access to compute infrastructure built with Nvidia‚Äôs cutting-edge GB300 GPUs, which will be deployed over phases through 2026 at IREN‚Äôs facility in Childress, Texas. This facility is planned to support an impressive 750 megawatts of capacity, signifying a massive undertaking to power the next generation of AI applications. This massive investment highlights several key aspects of Microsoft‚Äôs strategy: Meeting Surging Demand: The insatiable demand for generative AI, large language models, and complex AI workloads requires an unprecedented amount of computational power. This deal ensures Microsoft can continue to offer leading-edge AI services through Azure. Securing Premium Hardware: Access to Nvidia‚Äôs GB300 GPUs positions Microsoft at the forefront of AI hardware capabilities, crucial for high-performance computing. Diversifying Infrastructure: By partnering with specialized providers like IREN, Microsoft diversifies its infrastructure footprint and leverages external expertise in data center operations. IREN‚Äôs Pivotal Transformation: From Bitcoin Mining to AI Compute Powerhouse For those familiar with the digital asset space, IREN (Iris Energy) began its journey primarily as a bitcoin-mining operation. However, the company quickly realized that its massive collection of GPUs, initially deployed for cryptographic computations, were better put to use for the burgeoning demand of AI compute workloads. This strategic pivot has proven to be incredibly prescient and lucrative. The company has benefited massively from this shift in focus, transforming its business model to become a critical infrastructure provider for the AI revolution. The transition from bitcoin mining to AI compute is a fascinating case study in adaptability within the tech industry. Here‚Äôs why this shift was so impactful for IREN: Resource Reallocation: Bitcoin mining is highly energy-intensive and subject to volatile cryptocurrency markets. Repurposing existing GPU infrastructure for AI offers more stable, high-value revenue streams. Leveraging Existing Assets: IREN already possessed the core assets ‚Äì large-scale data centers and a significant fleet of GPUs ‚Äì making the pivot more efficient than starting from scratch. Strategic Market Positioning: By aligning with the explosive growth of AI, IREN positioned itself in a market with immense demand and less direct competition than the saturated crypto mining space. IREN‚Äôs CEO, Daniel Roberts, expects the Microsoft deal to take up only 10% of the company‚Äôs total capacity and generate about $1.94 billion in annualized revenue, as reported by Bloomberg. This indicates the sheer scale of IREN‚Äôs operations and the immense potential for further growth in the AI infrastructure market. The Power of Nvidia GPUs: Fueling Microsoft AI Ambitions At the heart of this deal are the state-of-the-art Nvidia GPUs , specifically the GB300 series. IREN said it is separately buying GPUs and equipment from Dell for about $5.8 billion to fulfill the requirements of this contract. This investment underscores the critical role Nvidia‚Äôs hardware plays in powering advanced AI applications. The GB300 NVL72 systems are optimized for reasoning models, agentic AI systems, and multi-modal generative AI, making them ideal for Microsoft‚Äôs ambitious AI projects. Microsoft‚Äôs commitment to Nvidia‚Äôs latest technology is not new. Just last month, the company launched its first production cluster with Nvidia‚Äôs GB300 NVL72 systems for Azure. This continuous integration of cutting-edge hardware is vital for Microsoft to maintain its competitive edge in the fast-paced AI market. The capabilities of these GPUs enable: Faster Training Times: Significantly reducing the time required to train complex AI models. Enhanced Inference Performance: Delivering quicker and more accurate responses from deployed AI systems. Scalability: Allowing Microsoft to scale its AI services to meet the growing demands of its global customer base. The collaboration between Microsoft, IREN, and Nvidia forms a powerful ecosystem designed to accelerate AI innovation and deployment on a grand scale. Microsoft AI: A Glimpse into the Broader Strategy and Competition This IREN deal is not an isolated event but rather a piece of a larger, aggressive strategy by Microsoft to dominate the Microsoft AI landscape. The company is actively forging partnerships and making substantial investments to secure the necessary compute resources. Last month, for instance, Microsoft signed a deal with Nscale for approximately 200,000 Nvidia GB300 GPUs to three data centers in Europe and one in the U.S. These deals collectively paint a picture of a company relentlessly building out its AI infrastructure to support its diverse range of AI products and services, from Azure AI to Copilot. The competitive landscape for AI compute capacity is intense, with tech giants like Google, Amazon, and Meta also investing heavily in their own AI infrastructure. Companies like CoreWeave, which also started as a bitcoin-mining operation before pivoting to AI, highlight a growing trend of specialized providers emerging to meet this demand. Microsoft‚Äôs strategy appears to be a multi-pronged approach: Internal Development: Continuing to innovate within Azure and its own data centers. Strategic Partnerships: Collaborating with firms like IREN and Nscale to rapidly expand capacity. Hardware Investments: Directly procuring the latest and most powerful GPUs from Nvidia and other vendors. This comprehensive approach ensures Microsoft remains a formidable player in the global AI race, providing its customers with the most advanced and scalable AI solutions. What are the Implications of Such Massive AI Investments? The scale of investments, such as Microsoft‚Äôs $9.7 billion deal with IREN, has far-reaching implications across the technology sector and beyond. These investments are not just about acquiring hardware; they are about shaping the future of digital services, economic competitiveness, and technological advancement. Benefits: Accelerated Innovation: More compute capacity means faster development and deployment of advanced AI models, leading to breakthroughs in various fields like healthcare, finance, and scientific research. Economic Growth: The construction and operation of these massive data centers create jobs and stimulate local economies, particularly in regions hosting these facilities. Democratization of AI: By providing scalable cloud-based AI services, Microsoft makes advanced AI accessible to a broader range of businesses and developers, fostering innovation across industries. Challenges: Energy Consumption: AI data centers are incredibly power-hungry. The 750 megawatts planned for IREN‚Äôs Childress facility alone highlight the significant energy demands, raising concerns about sustainability and grid stability. Supply Chain Dependence: The reliance on a few key hardware providers, primarily Nvidia, creates potential vulnerabilities in the supply chain and could lead to bottlenecks. Cost Escalation: The immense capital required for these investments could lead to higher costs for end-users or concentrate AI power in the hands of a few tech giants. The strategic decisions made today regarding AI infrastructure will define the capabilities and accessibility of AI for decades to come. Conclusion: A Monumental Step in the AI Race Microsoft‚Äôs monumental $9.7 billion, five-year deal with Australia‚Äôs IREN for AI cloud capacity marks a significant milestone in the ongoing race for AI dominance. It highlights Microsoft‚Äôs aggressive strategy to secure the necessary compute power, leveraging cutting-edge Nvidia GPUs , and underscores the successful pivot of companies like IREN from traditional bitcoin mining to high-value AI compute services. This partnership is not just a transaction; it‚Äôs a strategic alliance that will fuel the next generation of Microsoft AI innovation, pushing the boundaries of what artificial intelligence can achieve. As the demand for AI continues its exponential rise, such large-scale infrastructure deals will become increasingly common, shaping the technological landscape and determining the leaders of the AI era. The future of AI is being built on massive data centers, powered by advanced GPUs, and driven by strategic partnerships. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: What is the primary purpose of the $9.7 billion deal between Microsoft and IREN ? A1: The primary purpose of the deal is for Microsoft to secure significant additional AI cloud capacity from IREN (Iris Energy) over a five-year period. This capacity, built with Nvidia GB300 GPUs, is essential for meeting the surging customer demand for Microsoft‚Äôs AI services and developing advanced AI models. Q2: How did IREN transition from bitcoin mining to an AI infrastructure provider? A2: IREN initially operated as a bitcoin mining company, utilizing large fleets of GPUs. Recognizing the immense and growing demand for high-performance computing in AI, the company strategically pivoted its operations to repurpose its GPU infrastructure for AI compute workloads. This allowed them to leverage existing assets and capitalize on a more stable and high-value market, similar to how CoreWeave also made a similar transition. Q3: What role do Nvidia GPUs play in this deal? A3: Nvidia GPUs , specifically the advanced GB300 series, are central to the compute infrastructure that IREN will provide to Microsoft . These GPUs are critical for powering complex AI tasks such as reasoning models, agentic AI systems, and multi-modal generative AI. IREN is separately acquiring these GPUs and associated equipment from Dell for approximately $5.8 billion. Q4: How does this Microsoft ‚Äì IREN deal fit into Microsoft‚Äôs broader AI strategy? A4: This Microsoft ‚Äì IREN deal is part of Microsoft‚Äôs aggressive, multi-pronged strategy to secure a leading position in the Microsoft AI market. It complements other significant investments, such as the deal with Nscale for 200,000 Nvidia GB300 GPUs, and its ongoing internal development within Azure. These efforts aim to ensure Microsoft has ample AI cloud capacity to support its diverse AI product offerings and maintain its competitive edge, as noted by sources like Bloomberg reporting on CEO Daniel Roberts‚Äô insights. To learn more about the latest AI market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping AI models and institutional adoption. This post AI Cloud Capacity: Microsoft‚Äôs Strategic $9.7 Billion IREN Deal Unleashes Future Potential first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Will Ripple‚Äôs Price Keep Dumping? 900,000 XRP Sold by Whales in 5 Days
body: XRP‚Äôs price has dropped sharply over the past week after large token holders offloaded hundreds of thousands of coins. The recent decline is tied to increased selling activity from whale wallets and shifts in broader market behavior. At the time of writing, XRP is trading at $2.26. The 24-hour trading volume sits at $6.42 billion. The token has lost 13% over the last seven days and is down 6% in the past 24 hours. Whales Reduce Exposure as Price Falls Whale addresses holding between 100 million and 1 billion XRP have been reducing their holdings recently, according to analyst Ali Martinez. 900,000 $XRP sold by whales in just 5 days! pic.twitter.com/28404KMy24 ‚Äî Ali (@ali_charts) November 3, 2025 This activity took place during a period of sharp price decline for XRP. Charts show the asset falling from above $3.00 to the $2.40 range during this time. Similar behavior was observed in the weeks leading up to the drop, as noted by reports from CryptoPotato . Moreover, data from CryptoQuant shows that transfers of XRP from large wallets to exchanges have dropped off since the end of October. Notable spikes in activity were recorded on October 10, 16, and 25. After those dates, flows fell and stayed low. Source: CryptoQuant The 30-day average of these transfers has also trended downward, pointing to reduced sell-side pressure. While XRP‚Äôs price moved from over $2.90 to $2.30 during this period, the recent slowdown in exchange inflows may help ease further declines ‚Äî if demand holds steady. Technical Setup Shows Volatility Crypto analyst CryptoWZRD reported that both XRP/USD and XRP/BTC closed bearish recently, following an increase in Bitcoin dominance. ‚Äú XRP and XRPBTC both retested their support territory ,‚Äù the analyst said, noting that the outlook depends on how Bitcoin dominance moves going forward. In addition, the intraday chart showed strong volatility, with the price bouncing in a narrow range. Another analyst, CW, noted that XRP is currently supported by a buying wall but warned: ‚ÄúTwo selling walls exist until $2.57.‚Äù As previously reported , the current pattern may be part of a broader five-wave move, with the final leg possibly targeting the $2.00 zone. Away from price movement, Ripple has announced the launch of a digital asset spot prime brokerage service in the US. This platform allows institutional clients to execute over-the-counter spot transactions for a range of digital assets, including XRP and the RLUSD stablecoin. Furthermore, Ripple recently acquired Palisade, expanding its custody services beyond banks to include fintechs, corporates, and crypto-native firms. The post Will Ripple‚Äôs Price Keep Dumping? 900,000 XRP Sold by Whales in 5 Days appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Bitcoin Hashrate: Astounding Surge to All-Time High in October
body: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Hashrate: Astounding Surge to All-Time High in October The world of cryptocurrency is always buzzing with new developments, and October brought some truly remarkable news for Bitcoin enthusiasts. We‚Äôre talking about a significant milestone: the Bitcoin hashrate reaching an astonishing all-time high. This isn‚Äôt just a technical detail; it speaks volumes about the network‚Äôs health and future. What is the Bitcoin Hashrate and Why Does it Matter? The Bitcoin hashrate is essentially a measure of the total computational power being used to mine and process transactions on the Bitcoin network. Think of it as the collective ‚Äúmuscle‚Äù of all the mining equipment working together. A higher hashrate means: Increased Security: More power makes the network harder to attack. Greater Decentralization: Often indicates more participants contributing. Stronger Network Health: A sign of robust and growing interest in Bitcoin mining. When the Bitcoin hashrate hits a new record, it‚Äôs a strong indicator of the network‚Äôs resilience and ongoing expansion. October‚Äôs Astounding Bitcoin Hashrate Surge According to a recent JPMorgan report, which was cited by CoinDesk, the average Bitcoin hashrate soared to an incredible 1,082 exahashes per second (EH/s) in October. This marked a substantial 5% increase compared to the previous month. Such a surge demonstrates the continued investment and commitment within the Bitcoin mining sector. This achievement is particularly noteworthy because it happened amidst fluctuating market conditions, underscoring the long-term confidence miners have in Bitcoin. The consistent growth in Bitcoin hashrate shows that despite various challenges, the network continues to attract significant computational power. How Did This Impact Miners and the AI Pivot? While the overall network health improved, the increased competition from a higher Bitcoin hashrate did have an effect on individual miners. The JPMorgan report indicated that daily block rewards for miners averaged $48,000 per EH/s, which was a 3% decrease from the prior month. This shows the dynamic interplay between network growth and individual profitability. Interestingly, publicly listed U.S. mining firms saw their combined market capitalization jump by an impressive 25% in just one month, reaching approximately $70 billion. JPMorgan linked this growth to market expectations surrounding these companies‚Äô strategic pivot towards artificial intelligence (AI). This suggests a fascinating evolution within the mining industry: Diversification: Miners are exploring new revenue streams beyond just Bitcoin block rewards. Technological Adaptation: Leveraging powerful computing infrastructure for other high-demand applications like AI. Future-Proofing: A move to enhance long-term viability and investor appeal. This shift highlights a forward-thinking approach, where the infrastructure built for mining the Bitcoin hashrate can be repurposed or augmented for other computationally intensive tasks. What‚Äôs Next for Bitcoin Hashrate and Mining? The continuous rise of the Bitcoin hashrate suggests a robust and expanding network. This trend is likely to continue as more efficient mining hardware becomes available and global interest in Bitcoin grows. However, miners will need to remain agile, especially concerning energy costs and technological advancements. The pivot to AI by some mining firms also opens up new avenues for growth and investment. It could lead to more diversified business models, making these companies less solely dependent on Bitcoin price fluctuations. As the industry matures, we can expect further innovations and adaptations. In conclusion, October‚Äôs record-breaking Bitcoin hashrate is a powerful testament to the network‚Äôs strength and security. While it brings challenges for individual miner profitability, it also showcases the innovative spirit of the mining industry, particularly with the strategic move towards AI. This ongoing evolution ensures Bitcoin remains a secure and dynamic digital asset for the future. Frequently Asked Questions About Bitcoin Hashrate Q: What does an ‚Äúall-time high‚Äù Bitcoin hashrate signify? A: An all-time high Bitcoin hashrate indicates that the network is more secure and robust than ever before. It means more computational power is dedicated to processing transactions and securing the blockchain, making it significantly harder for malicious actors to attack. Q: How does the Bitcoin hashrate impact Bitcoin‚Äôs price? A: While not a direct cause-and-effect, a rising Bitcoin hashrate is generally seen as a positive indicator of network health and miner confidence, which can indirectly contribute to positive market sentiment and potentially influence price over the long term. Q: What is an EH/s? A: EH/s stands for Exahashes per second. It‚Äôs a unit of measurement for the computational power of the Bitcoin network. One exahash is equal to one quintillion (1,000,000,000,000,000,000) hashes per second, demonstrating the immense scale of Bitcoin mining operations. Q: Why are mining firms pivoting to AI? A: Mining firms possess vast amounts of high-performance computing (HPC) infrastructure. This infrastructure, initially used for calculating the Bitcoin hashrate , can be repurposed or augmented to perform other computationally intensive tasks, such as training artificial intelligence models. This pivot offers diversification and new revenue streams, especially as the demand for AI computing power grows. Q: Does a higher hashrate mean more Bitcoin is being mined? A: No, a higher Bitcoin hashrate does not mean more Bitcoin is being mined in total. Bitcoin‚Äôs supply schedule is fixed, with a block reward halving approximately every four years. A higher hashrate means more competition among miners to earn those fixed block rewards. Was this deep dive into the astonishing Bitcoin hashrate surge insightful? We hope you found it informative and engaging! Share this article with your friends, fellow crypto enthusiasts, and anyone curious about the evolving world of Bitcoin mining and its exciting future. Your shares help us continue to deliver valuable insights! To learn more about the latest explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin‚Äôs institutional adoption. This post Bitcoin Hashrate: Astounding Surge to All-Time High in October first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: KITE Perpetual Futures: Unleash Thrilling Opportunities on Binance
body: BitcoinWorld KITE Perpetual Futures: Unleash Thrilling Opportunities on Binance Binance is once again setting the pace in the cryptocurrency derivatives market with a significant announcement. The global exchange has confirmed the upcoming listing of KITE perpetual futures , an exciting development for traders worldwide. This new contract is scheduled to go live at 1:00 p.m. UTC on November 3rd, promising up to 25x leverage. This move opens up fresh avenues for market participants, allowing them to engage with the KITE asset in a dynamic and potentially highly profitable manner. However, it also introduces complexities that require careful consideration. Let‚Äôs delve into what this listing entails and how traders can best prepare. What Are KITE Perpetual Futures and Why Should Traders Care? Firstly, it‚Äôs crucial to understand what KITE perpetual futures are. Unlike traditional futures contracts that have an expiry date, perpetual futures do not. This means traders can hold their positions indefinitely, as long as they maintain sufficient margin. This flexibility is a major draw for many. Moreover, the offering of up to 25x leverage significantly amplifies potential gains. Leverage allows traders to control a large position with a relatively small amount of capital. For instance, with 25x leverage, a trader can open a $2,500 position with just $100.
